p:
The tensile strength was calculated as follows:
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$${\rm{TS}}({\rm{MPa}})={\rm{F}}/{\rm{S}}$$\end{document}
TS
(
MPa
)
= F / S
In the formula, F was the maximum tensile force when the edible film broke, and S was the cross-sectional area of the edible film.
